Professional Experience

Siimee™

February of 2023 to Present

Visit Siimee™

About Siimee

"Siimee is a social impact company committed to reforming the recruiting and hiring process by reducing the biases that often occur."

My Involvement

At Siimee, I filled many roles, including using JavaScript to program a series of essential features such as login and onboarding. Additionally, I finalized the chat feature of the app, showcasing a privacy focused implementation, where user's can reveal their profile data piecemeal. Lastly, I researched existing recruiting and hiring platforms which contributed to UX/UI decisions made during the creation of the app.

Volunteer Work

Code for PDX

April of 2023 to Present

Visit Code for PDX

About Code for PDX

"As a Code for America Brigade, we're part of a national network of civic-minded volunteers who contribute their skills toward using the web as a platform for local government and community service."

My Involvement

At Code for PDX, I was involved in working on their PASS project. Currently still in early development, the PASS application utilizes Solid Data Pods as decentralized data stores to digitally archive documents for housing insecure individuals. Thus far I have finished implementing securely transferring sensitive client data from scanned driver's license PDF417 barcodes into Solid Data Pods, utilizing the JavaScript version of the zxing barcode scanning library.

Personal Projects

CityStats API

February of 2023 to Present

Visit CityStats APISource Code/Documentation

About CityStats API

"CityStats API returns essential statistics about all 50 American states as well as the top most populous 229 cities in America."

Project Description

I wrote CityStats as a way of easily accessing essential statistics about American cities and states. While the US census has its own API, I found it unintuitive and decided to write my own version. Utilizing python's Beautiful Soup Library, I created a web scraping script. This script alongside GNU's cron command line utility, automatically updates the API's data each election cycle (with some human intervention to ensure accuracy). Using a NodeJS/Express server along with a SQLite database, I hosted this API on the Linode Cloud Platform (now Akamai), with the intention that it be used by the general public and developers.

brianhayes.dev

May of 2023 to Present

Source Code/Documentation

About This Website

"You're currently visiting my personal portfolio website and blog! Inspired in part by the minimalist style of scribe, this site is meant to invite you to take a look at some of my humble works and perhaps read one of my blog posts on software and other topics."

Project Description

This blog is actually the third version of this website, which strives to be more readable and minimal than the previous two iterations. The last version of this blog, titled "LeafBytes", can still be found here, preserved for purposes of posterity. While the previous version had some nice CSS animations, and the source code features some of my essential skills in VueJS, I wanted to get back to basics with this iteration of my blog.

Thusly, this latest version of my website is written in simple HTML, CSS, and a small amount of JavaScript (okay okay, I used PugJS instead of just pure HTML, but you get the idea 😉). It is running via an NGINX server hosted on an Akamai/Linode Cloud instance. All these icons you see can be credited to the awesome designers over at Iconify!
